title: apple-codesign/README: Fix rcodesign remote install command line
body:
The previous command line produced the error:

```
error: could not find `rcodesign` in https://github.com/indygreg/PyOxidizer?branch=main with version `*`
```

title: debian-packaging: Derive hash for PackageVersion
body:
Useful when e.g. when wanting to stick package name + version in a hash
table.

Signed-off-by: Sjoerd Simons <sjoerd@collabora.com>

title: pyoxidizer: Fix Typos
body: Signed-off-by: Ryan Russell <git@ryanrussell.org>

title: apple-flat-package: make version a string
body:
[PackageInfo version](https://github.com/indygreg/PyOxidizer/blob/72ecaa846f40d2dcb18464c9a9c6d838654bbb7d/apple-flat-package/src/package_info.rs#L78) is typed as `u32` but it could be actually an `string` ([reference](http://s.sudre.free.fr/Stuff/Ivanhoe/FLAT.html)). For example, a semantic version (like `2.12.2`) is a valid version.

Fixes: #571

title: Correct bad closing perenthesis in new-pyoidizer.blz.hbs
apple-codesign: Enable loading binary as well as XML Info.plists.
body: I've encountered iOS applications using binary `Info.plist`.  This change enables the bundle signer to work with them.

title: Support for overriding URLs via environment variables
body: I haven't been able to test this yet (I don't have a Windows machine). Is there a good place to add automated tests for this?

title: cryptographic-message-syntax: Add support for parsing signatures that use SHA512 digests
body:
This commit adds support for parsing CMS signatures that use SHA512 digests. Ubuntu's kernel module signatures, for example, use SHA512. Example signature I used for testing: [ubuntu.ko.sig.gz](https://github.com/indygreg/PyOxidizer/files/6372977/ubuntu.ko.sig.gz) Sample signature's details from openssl:
openssl cms -inform der -in output.ko.sig -cmsout -noout -print ``` CMS_ContentInfo: contentType: pkcs7-signedData (1.2.840.113549.1.7.2) d.signedData: version: 1 digestAlgorithms: algorithm: sha512 (2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.3) parameter: encapContentInfo: eContentType: pkcs7-data (1.2.840.113549.1.7.1) eContent: certificates: crls: signerInfos: version: 1 d.issuerAndSerialNumber: issuer: CN=Build time autogenerated kernel key serialNumber: 0x7825C20A4E41607B4A4E194A8F0C8AEE314D54BF digestAlgorithm: algorithm: sha512 (2.16.840.1.101.3.4.2.3) parameter: signedAttrs: signatureAlgorithm: algorithm: rsaEncryption (1.2.840.113549.1.1.1) parameter: NULL signature: 0000 - 7d 6d 94 f8 57 06 54 4f-f5 a4 76 51 dd 61 83 }m..W.TO..vQ.a. 000f - 63 3b 90 52 c3 d2 02 cb-aa b1 a0 ca 1f da dc c;.R........... 001e - 37 b4 9c 64 01 23 35 12-2a b0 22 44 66 1b e7 7..d.#5.*."Df.. 002d - 7a f5 91 b3 7d e2 af 0b-60 8a ab 43 ec 15 c1 z...}...`..C... 003c - f0 7d e2 7a d6 fd b5 24-ef 4e 52 2a d6 92 53 .}.z...$.NR*..S 004b - 7a ba e8 f4 27 39 29 2b-18 71 96 e5 31 0a 10 z...'9)+.q..1.. 005a - ed a2 f6 b6 8b 79 23 02-47 2f b3 48 9c 96 2f .....y#.G/.H../ 0069 - e9 bf 22 d5 87 2d bb 07-80 63 4e a4 02 68 13 .."..-...cN..h. 0078 - 97 bd 63 e9 82 e6 8e 30-ae c8 74 e4 5b 38 73 ..c....0..t.[8s 0087 - c8 a5 2d b9 fb ea 25 18-dd d0 2a ba ae b6 cd ..-...%...*.... 0096 - dc 1e 98 b9 54 7b c0 cc-45 98 41 41 a4 1a 27 ....T{..E.AA..' 00a5 - e4 4d 27 01 c1 3d 51 64-56 80 04 2a fe 5f 52 .M'..=QdV..*._R 00b4 - b0 75 a4 b1 d3 2f a6 85-4d eb 52 37 4a 4b a3 .u.../..M.R7JK. 00c3 - fe 52 d9 23 d0 f8 d6 85-dc ab b6 51 d8 2f 2d .R.#.......Q./- 00d2 - 1b 09 ad c6 c5 93 28 e8-80 14 7c 2e 36 ae 8f ......(...|.6.. 00e1 - de a9 be 11 39 ab 07 72-9f ce 27 97 69 a6 d9 ....9..r..'.i.. 00f0 - 6a a0 50 d6 ba f0 16 b9-24 6b 64 2c d1 ac a0 j.P.....$kd,... 00ff - 12 eb 1e 17 d6 5c a8 4b-8f 08 55 af 9a d6 eb .....\.K..U.... 010e - c6 76 80 15 4c a2 d8 19-b2 ed 6f 00 32 90 b4 .v..L.....o.2.. 011d - 6c c1 5e a4 ec 2d 09 a3-ff 5c 2b 4f 00 86 c6 l.^..-...\+O... 012c - 4b 1a c1 32 96 2c ee d4-7b ce 56 b5 5d 92 a1 K..2.,..{.V.].. 013b - 9e f0 b3 0e 6c fd 3f 55-b1 00 16 a2 81 fb 9e ....l.?U....... 014a - 49 e9 99 0f e3 f3 82 b1-b4 df 13 5d 8f 2c e2 I..........].,. 0159 - 0b d5 8a 7e 4d 4b 79 40-da 72 ba 96 f6 84 62 ...~MKy@.r....b 0168 - 18 7e 98 78 c9 da eb c5-f4 65 66 04 6f 46 eb .~.x.....ef.oF. 01a4 - 2b a0 1b 2c 60 10 f5 db-c4 ad 42 e3 d1 08 68 +..,`.....B...h 01b3 - fd f2 50 d6 ba 32 43 f3-c6 f0 de b5 d6 29 9e ..P..2C......). 01c2 - c8 c1 22 d9 34 b1 9c 4f-67 c2 08 6e 78 47 a2 ..".4..Og..nxG. 01fe - 2c 1e ,. unsignedAttrs: ```
openssl asn1parse -i -in ubuntu.ko.sig -inform der ``` 0:d=0 hl=4 l= 677 cons: SEQUENCE 4:d=1 hl=2 l= 9 prim: OBJECT :pkcs7-signedData 15:d=1 hl=4 l= 662 cons: cont [ 0 ] 19:d=2 hl=4 l= 658 cons: SEQUENCE 23:d=3 hl=2 l= 1 prim: INTEGER :01 26:d=3 hl=2 l= 13 cons: SET 28:d=4 hl=2 l= 11 cons: SEQUENCE 30:d=5 hl=2 l= 9 prim: OBJECT :sha512 41:d=3 hl=2 l= 11 cons: SEQUENCE 43:d=4 hl=2 l= 9 prim: OBJECT :pkcs7-data 54:d=3 hl=4 l= 623 cons: SET 58:d=4 hl=4 l= 619 cons: SEQUENCE 62:d=5 hl=2 l= 1 prim: INTEGER :01 65:d=5 hl=2 l= 70 cons: SEQUENCE 67:d=6 hl=2 l= 46 cons: SEQUENCE 69:d=7 hl=2 l= 44 cons: SET 71:d=8 hl=2 l= 42 cons: SEQUENCE 73:d=9 hl=2 l= 3 prim: OBJECT :commonName 78:d=9 hl=2 l= 35 prim: UTF8STRING :Build time autogenerated kernel key 115:d=6 hl=2 l= 20 prim: INTEGER :7825C20A4E41607B4A4E194A8F0C8AEE314D54BF 137:d=5 hl=2 l= 11 cons: SEQUENCE 139:d=6 hl=2 l= 9 prim: OBJECT :sha512 150:d=5 hl=2 l= 13 cons: SEQUENCE 152:d=6 hl=2 l= 9 prim: OBJECT :rsaEncryption 163:d=6 hl=2 l= 0 prim: NULL 165:d=5 hl=4 l= 512 prim: OCTET STRING [HEX DUMP]: ```

title: rcodesign: add support for custom entitlements
body: Adds an optional `-e` argument, which takes a path to an entitlements plist.

title: cleanup: rename new-pyoxidizer.bzl to new-pyoxidizer.bzl.hbs
body:
I keep getting blocked by buildifier[0] presubmit checks because the template
isn't a valid bzl file. It appears to be pretty usual to use .hbs as a
suffix on handlebars files, so rename the .bzl file to .bzl.hbs to
avoid the presubmit trying to force us to format a templated file.

Sigh.

0: https://github.com/bazelbuild/buildtools/blob/master/buildifier/README.md

title: cleanup: fix typo "confis" in method name
cleanup: replace copy_dir crate with fs_extra crate
body:
The former appears to be largely abandoned and depends on an ancient
walkdir crate. The latter appears to be actively maintained, and this
prunes the ancient walkdir from our dependencies.

title: PyO3 supports stable Rust as of version 0.11.0 (Jun 28, 2020)
pyoxidizer: upgrade to reqwest 0.10 from 0.9
body:
We have to use the `blocking` feature to get a drop-in blocking-API
client, but then it was a clean upgrade. This removes several
duplicates in the dependency graph shown by `cargo tree --duplicates`.

title: Minor documentation typo fix in rust_rust_code.rst
Docs tweaks
Removes typo "_intsall" to "install"
body: Nothing more, keep up the great work!

title: #226 update documentation to make it more explicit about the filesystem importer
body: https://github.com/indygreg/PyOxidizer/issues/226

title: docs: expand PyInstaller comparison
body:
- add single file / single dir options
- link ZlibArchive documentation
- point the different packaging requirements (no need to build
  in PyInstaller)

Issue #36

title: Fix loading of resources using incorrect offset
body:
Hi! Thanks for this awesome project.

When using `__loader__.get_resource_loader(package).open_resource(filename)`, we were getting a strange result: the contents of the file came out together with the content of other embedded files.

Turns out it was always reading from the start of the first file, since the data offset wasn't getting updated as it moved along the files.

This is my first contribution to a Rust project, so feel free to tell me if I made some mistake, though the change is simple enough that I hope I haven't 😄

title: Get rid of benign warnings about trait objects and dyn
body:
Before:
```
warning: trait objects without an explicit `dyn` are deprecated
```
Now: fixed :D

title: Avoid panic from unwrap() when no arg for analyze
repair: pip-requirements-file type args must be requirements_path not…
body:
… path

   [[packaging_rule]]
   type = "pip-requirements-file"
   path = "/home/gps/src/myapp/requirements.txt"

to

   [[packaging_rule]]
   type = "pip-requirements-file"
   requirements_path = "/home/gps/src/myapp/requirements.txt"

title: Clarify context: building portable binaries
body:
At first it seemed like the "execution environment for binaries" would defeat the whole purpose of distributing a portable binary.
Trying to clarify that.

title: Fix grammar in first FAQ sentence
body: Upon further reading, I guess if you really want to make the phrase "turn Python into distributable" into an adjective, the other alternative is to put dashes in there. But as is, it was so distracting and clear to me that this was a simple typo that I made a whole fork 8)

title: Support extra_args for pip install simple
body:
This pull request references #42

 -  added extra_args to pip install simple
 -  added documentation

I've looked at the TODO for piping stderr to stdout, it seems to be hard to do with the standard library, a crate named duct seems to be adapted to what we're looking for, I wasn't sure if you wanted another dependency or if there was a simpler way to do it so I kept it out of the pull request for now.

title: Issue when extracting Python distributions on windows (long paths)
body:
This references issue #28
- added canonicalization so longer paths work on windows 10

title: Fix bug when running setup.py
body: In the current build cmd.stdout.as_mut().unwrap(); on line 1136 fails and the output of running setup.py goes to the command line. I believe this change fixes things.

title: Fix tiny typo in readme
Typo fix
body: Will look to contribute more substantively when I've had a good look through the code!

title: Typo
Fix typo PyOxidizer -> PyInstaller
